hook.text: A waiter performs being a waiter so perfectly that he's no longer a person â€” just a role.

buildup.text: Sartre called this bad faith: lying to yourself about your own freedom to avoid its burden.

discovery.text: Bad faith means pretending you have no choice. 'I had to,' 'that's just who I am,' 'I had no option.'

twist.text: It's not conscious deception. You genuinely convince yourself. That's what makes it so dangerous.

climax.text: Every time you hide behind a role, a label, or 'the way things are,' you're in bad faith.

punchline.text: Bad faith is the lie you tell yourself about yourself.

quiz.question: What is 'bad faith' according to Sartre?
options: Deceiving yourself about your own freedom
